channel.title: How would I do this kinda of math?
channel.description:
How would I do this I'm having a hard time with it =s :rolleyes: could someone explain these out to me?
1: If a = 24 and b = 45, then c = _________ 43 49 51 63
2: If a = 5 and b = 12, then c = _________ 11 13 15 17
3: If a = 8 and b = 15, then c = _________ 17 18 19 √396

Eh, Dad is at work all day sister pisses me off mom works +P + the teachers are rude =p Not very Indulgent either =i

you could be star of “It’s a hard knock life”

item.title: How would I do this kinda of math?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Volumes?
Rectangular prism is lwh (length * width * height)
Square right pyramid is 1/3 bh (where base is the area of the base square…and this is the same for a right cone, but b is the base of the circie base.)
Right cylinder is bh (where b is the areas of the circle base)
Sphere is 4/3πr^3

Read full topic

item.title: How would I do this kinda of math?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

A cube is a 3-dimensional figure with the sides of each dimension (length, width, depth) are the same. Therefore, to find the volume you need s * s * s, or s^3 (s cubed).

Read full topic

item.title: How would I do this kinda of math?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

On your calculator, there is a button like this: √

You use that to get the square root.

To my knowledge, you cannot do it in your head. And if there is an equation for it, well then thats definitly not something you learn in grade8.

But, often they can be done in your head. Basically, the square root has to equal a number * it’s self.

Square root of 64 = 8
Why? Because 8*8 = 64

Square root of 49 = 7
Why? Because 7*7 = 49

Square root of 2601 = 51
Why? Because 51*51 = 2601

Read full topic

item.title: How would I do this kinda of math?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

a[sup]2[/sup]+b[sup]2[/sup]=c[sup]2[/sup]

This is EXTREMELY simple stuff. Im not doing the homework for you, but look:

1: If a = 24 and b = 45, then c = _________
43
49
51
63

Alright, so what is A squared? If a = 24, then 24 squared is just 24*24, therefore it is 576.

If b = 45, then 45 squared = 45*45, which is 2025

So, C[sup]2[/sup]=576+2025 (Remember, a2+b2=c2)

C[sup]2[/sup]= 2601

Now we dont want C[sup]2[/sup], we want just C. So to do that we get the square root of 2601. I dont know whow to make that symbol on a computer, but its like a checkmark on your calculator.

Square root of 2601 = 51

So therefore, c=51

Read full topic
